Review title: Could of been more but during circumstances
Review_body: I don't hate this film but I couldn't help but feel a little disappointed that it could of been more developed with the script but because of Brandon Lee's untimely death it came too short to what could of been a great movie to something that felt b-grade unfortunately.For example the way he exacted his revenge to the criminals he killed them straight away, if he wanted them to suffer as much as he did he would find out what they love the most and turned it against them and eventually let them die in a slow or grisly death, especially when you can't die and you can take your time. He only did this once to one baddie in a burning car.Doesn't go through to detail of him questioning why this happen and how much hate or why nobody has done any justice. But in all the ending was perfect. I wanted to see the satisfaction from the Crow and I got it, makes it more compelling that Brandon Lee was engaged as well just before he died.

So this is a strange looking but still beautifully made film about a rock star, Eric Draven (Brandon Lee), who's murdered and his fiancé, Shelly Webster, who was beaten, raped and later dies in an intensive care unit. The two are killed on Devil's Night, October 30, the night before their wedding by T-Bird and his gang on orders from Detroit drug lord Top Dollar (Michael Wincott). Devil's Night in Detroit, according to this movie is a night of crime and rampant acts of arson committed by gangs like T-Bird's who use arson as a way of destroying evidence and intimidating people. A year after he is killed, Eric returns from the grave to seek vengeance for his and Shelley's murders. Dressed in dark ragged clothing and Hellequin make-up, as The Crow, Eric seems to be impervious to gunshots and have near superhuman strength. He's guided by a crow, a supernatural symbol of death and perhaps salvation or transcendence, that allows him to track the movements of his enemies. Eric's death and undead mission of vengeance intersect with the lives Sergeant Albrecht and Sarah. Sgt. Albrecht was a first responding police officer who stayed with Shelley while she was in intensive care until she died. Sarah was a skater girl who's neglectful junkie mother caused her to spend much of her time with Eric and Shelley when she wasn't skateboarding. Both of them were directly affected by Eric and Shelley's deaths, and later help Eric's quest for revenge. Eric's makeup and dress were influenced by English goth rock as seen in Crow creator James O'Barr's source comic material, in particular Bauhaus lead singer Peter Murphy. James O'Barr's own loss of his fiancé to a drunk driver and love of goth rock inspired the story. Alex Proyas, a director who came to movies from a short film and music video background, does an excellent job of making Detroit look like a smoky empty industrial wasteland (which it sadly is) that was also strangely beautiful and appealing. Great entertaining film for action film who want some substance to their viewing or even Bruce Lee connoisseurs who want to see the kind of superstar potential Brandon Lee possessed.

Review title: An artful, action packed, tragic masterpiece
Review_body: The crow is simply a sublime masterpiece. A visually stunning, cult favorite that captivated the world in the wake of Brandon Lee's On set Death. The films tragedy added to it's brilliant emotional undertone. I must admit i don't usually cry in emotional films, but there was a poetic beauty to this film that made me ball my eyes out. It has a rare sensitivity that men in particular can relate to. Love, Rock n Roll, blood and passion, this is the ultimate mans movie. A must for lovers of dark atmospheric urban setting and electric cast performances. The Crow is a classic in every sense, made even more memorable by the tragic death of a star Brandon Lee, who had the world at his feet and a promising future. Awesome movie.Recommendation: boys, black mascara and rock n roll is back in!

I always wanted to see this film, but I never got to see it in theaters. So I rented it. When I saw it I loved it. It was my favorite film for a while. I saw the sequel, was not as great. I saw an Episode of "The Crow: Stairway to Heaven", but it uses the Crow as more of a Detective and Ninja than what The Crow is. I hope it gets cancelled really soon. It is too cheap.Well back to the film, I was so sad to see that this man, (Brandon Lee)The son of Martial Arts, was no longer with us. This would've made Brandon a star. He would've gone on to be like his father. I could imagine if he were alive. He could've played Darth Maul. He would've been great. But, him and his father are no longer with us.

Review title: A great film but give the follow ups a miss!
Review_body: I followed the making of this film quite closely after the lead star Brandon Lee was tragically killed during the making of the film. It happened when a gun used to fire live rounds was then used to fire blanks during a scene with Brandon Lee. The gun wasn't cleaned and checked correctly and it was discovered that a round that had been previously fired had failed to fire correctly. The bullet lodged in the barrel and remained there until the gun was used with blank rounds. The force of the blank firing was enough to propel the bullet out of the barrel and fatally wounded Brandon Lee. This led to many changes in the use of firearms on set, sadly however these changes were too late and the movie world lost a truly great rising star.The film is ironically about the murder of the character played by Brandon Lee. He then comes back from the grave to avenge his death and the brutal rape and murder of his girlfriend Shelly by a gang.The film is a masterpiece and visually stunning. It is a very dark film and the visuals portray this extremely well. The cast includes Brandon Lee, Ernie Hudson & Michael Wincott. The acting is great from most of the cast with very over the top performances by the gang members and a near perfect stand out performance by Brandon Lee. Having only seen him in action martial arts movies prior to this his acting ability really stands out here and shows what potential he had.This is a really good film and knowing the background into the death of the lead actor helps to bring a sense of reality to it. However without the tragic accident this is still a great film. More fantasy than horror it has a great story that really draws you in and doesn't let go until the end.Unfortunately someone decided the film needed some very poor sequels! However a short lived TV series was made using the original characters and it was actually quite good.If you have never seen this please give it a go, it's a great film but give the follow ups a miss!

This film may of lacked originality in soryline, but i tell you what, it kept me glued to my seat from start to finish.  Brandon Lee is excellent as the revenge seeking Eric Dravon who wants to avenge the death of  fiancee on the night of haloween.  1 year later he erects from his grave to seek the murderers and he slowly kills them off one by one.I have this film on DVD and every aspect of this story is mindblowing especially the soundtrack which is outstanding.  it was such a big shame that Brandon Lee could not of made the sequels more successful because he really did make the 1st outing magic!!!!!!9/10 - brilliant stuff!!!!!!!

Review title: A No Frills Shoot-Em Up Revenge Ride
Review_body: The beauty of The Crow is that it's all about revenge without waiting for the afterlife. This movie is unique that it is one of few modern dark films that are shot in a noir-esquire style; like Blade Runner, Underworld, and the Matrix it reflects a bleak and terrible future riddled with crime and infamy. Brandon Lee (the son of legendary Kung Fu master Bruce Lee) plays the human behind a terrible tragedy in which he comes alive again with the help of the myth of the Crow. The film is a no-frills shoot up the bad guys without any significant martial arts (although Brandon was trained like his father  both Lees died tragically) As with many films today, this film dabbles with the mysteries of the supernatural, where both the evil and good have some control over mysterious powers that they seem to just attain without any background. Of course, there is a host of other side characters that add to Mr. Lee's need to pursue his main goal. "You're all gonna die anyway!" RATING: 9.5/10 SPECIAL NOTE: A terrible tragedy, Brandon Lee was accidentally killed during the filming of The Crow, due to a blank shell entering his chest. The story is not unlike the Crowhe was engaged to be married but was killed on the set of the movie that would reveal his own fate

The Crow has become more than just a cult movie among fans. It has become a visual and musical masterpiece that set the bar for movies, with few marching since the initial release. The 90's was the last great decade of music. A decade that wove music and visual into stunning movies. The Crow will forever live as an epic. No reboots on this one. Let the original stand and shine till the end.
Yeah he died filming it, doesn't mean it's a good movie. It just ain't a good joint.

Review title: What a load of melodramatic crap
Review_body: This is a poorly constructed film and its premise is juvenile, inane and asinine. What a load of melodramatic crap. If I was eating Burger King for a week and watching nothing but Fassbinder every day, my crap would be more interesting to watch than The Crow. Christ, a guy died to make this load of diaper filling? On a scale of 1 to 10 this movie is a 1. If this movie were a dish at a Mexican restaurant it would be an ASS-TACO. Goth movies are always bad because the material is very childish and silly. The acting is like an after school special and the writing... well it looks like it was written by Goths. If you think this is a good piece of cinema please stop reading comic books... pick up some Paul Bowles, James Joyce or Mikail Bulgakov and open your mind. Just like these real writers, real filmmakers have names like Godard, Bunuel, Von Trier and Lynch.

A stylish revenge fantasy film inspired by the graphic novel by James O' Barr, which in turn, was inspired by the real-life murder of his girlfriend by a drunk driver.The title refers to the crow that brings the main character, Eric Draven back to life after a year to avenge his and fiancée, Shelly Webster's murder at the hands of the city's most notorious gang members. And is, of course, the final film of the man who plays him, Brandon Lee, who was fatally injured on set by a stunt that went awry.I admit to not being familiar with Lee's previous work as it mostly consists of martial arts movies, which don't really interest me, but in regards to his performance as Eric, he was putting his heart and soul into the role and it shows.He displays all the key emotions you'd expect to see in a man who has already lost everything dear to him and has nothing else left to lose, perfectly. He plays Eric with vulnerability, sadness, rage, a thirst for vengeance and just the right amount of child-like mischievousness of someone who knows he can can basically do whatever he wants with no consequences. I couldn't do a review of The Crow without mentioning Ernie Hudson, who plays my favourite character, Police Officer Albrecht who aids Eric on his quest for vengeance. He provides the 'every man' perspective and occasional comic relief.In any other genre, having one-dimensional villains can really weaken a film but as this is a revenge fantasy it isn't necessary to know how the villains came to be or what they do when they're not being scumbags. The main villain, mob boss Top Dollar, alludes to having tragedy in his past but ultimately falls into the category of "man who just wants to watch the world burn" (to quote another movie featuring a man with a painted face who also died in tragic circumstances).The story of Eric and Shelly's relationship is told through the use of flashbacks and it's a pity we don't get to see more of them together on screen. I never had any trouble believing they were in love, it just would have been nice to see.

This is a brilliant film.So many hidden messages and expressionistic pictures.Like you are being caught up in a dream that hurts,but its too damn interesting and incredible that you dont wanna get out of it.This movie is clearly a touching study of the way our society has been developing since the early 90's.Look at what has happened in this last decade.Its like this movie sees it all through and sums it up.The nightmare within.Brandon Lee....what can i say?Such a loss,so much to give and show the world.Taken just at the moment when he was about to show us what he really was capable of.Supporting cast is flawless.This movie could have been less bloody maybe...but the blood never blinded the purpose of it.Watch it,admire it and learn from it.Rest in peace Brandon.

Review title: This is the movie that defined the neo-Goth era!!!!
Review_body: Yeah,Yeah, I was a part of the Goth style around Seattle, but only after I saw this movie!!! Atmosphere, visualization etc.,etc., I can't say enough!! This is one of those movie's that almost made me cry (the best any movie can do) which to me, despite Lee's death, is an achievement, believe me, I saw it quite a few times and my reaction is the same (I must be a freak!!) Anyhow, I forgot how I was going to pick everything apart on this movie, so I'll leave this alone... a 10!

This Gothic action movie based upon the comic book by James O'Bar turned out to be a surprising success, not just in my eyes but in many people's. This was within the top 5 best movies I've ever seen.  Rarely does an action movie have such a powerful effect upon your emotions.  The acting was done well by each and every actor in the cast.  The atmosphere is very constant throughout the movie, and it just grabs you from the beginning scene and holds you until the very end.  You will never forget this movie once you see it.  There are many memorable lines in the script and I guarantee it will stick to you.  I'm sure Brandon Lee would have been proud to see the project completed.

I saw this 3 times at the cinema and seen it so many times since on DVD. I have never got bored watching it again.a dark brooding movie set in a dark world which all martial arts, action and Gothic movie fans will love.The film is full of edgy characters that pull off an amazing performance. Brandon lee is the crow! The crow is without a doubt better than anything he has done before.so many characters and such a powerful story, this movie will keep you gripped. I'm not going to go into the plot just whole heartedly recommend this film to everyone.I will say all the sequels and TV shows that followed are really bad in comparison. If you've seen any of them don't be put off. this is the only version worth watching

A fantastic performance from Brandon Lee that still holds up to this day. You could just tell he loved every minute of playing this character and it majorly sucks he had to die the way he did. The Crow, directed by Alex Proyas is a dark, vibrant movie. It is violent yes, but it has a lot of heart and emotion too. Made even more so by the fact of Brandon's untimely passing. It's a moody and fun action flick and all the actors who play the bad guys nail their parts in it. Made in 1993, the film was released in 1994. It has that feel of something out of the 90's, a grunginess to it.. and the soundtrack and score perfectly fit into this. Mortal Kombat is the best video game to movie adaptation in my opinion, and this very well may be the greatest comic book to movie adaption. There's no denying that. All in all, this is a darkly fun, grungy, gothic comic book film. A terrific performance from Brandon Lee. Watch it if you haven't seen it. There is a cool book written about it by Bridget Biass. It's titled The Crow: The Story Behind The Film. Filled with tons of information about the making of the movie, the before and after process, all the people involved and there's lots of stuff to read about Brandon too. This movie deserves its cult status and is worth watching every devil's night if you ask me.

Review title: this movie is my absolute favorite of all times
Review_body: it has exactly the right mood, fatalistic feeling, darkness, mystery, love, hate and poesy. it also managed to hit me at the right time in the right mood for sure a movie about revenge, justice and love beyond the grave, it manages to keep you under pressure all the time, even with the main character seemingly indestructible at the beginning. the characters are great and unique, featuring what i find some of the most interesting and funny bad guys. the lines they trade and the acting delivered by the actors is beautiful too, and still feels fresh after all the times i watched it.the soundtrack even manages to improve the already well created mood, with bands like the cure, machines of loving grace and stone temple pilots - in fact i first discovered the soundtrack and loved it :) the movie manages to inspire me each time i watch it, and there surely have been 20-30 times already. i've never watched anything like it, not in terms of mood, story or mystery, but the action is beautiful too, as is every shot in it ...yeah, i know - i'm better when ranting about one i didn't like ... this is why i waited so long before writing something about this one ... still doesn't seem right, but i will improve it with the time Eric Draven: "Victims - aren't we all..."

**1/2 out of ****Starts off strong, but then just drags on and too often resorts to excessive violence. Brandon Lee gives a good performance and is very likeable in the title role. Ernie Hudson is also good as a former detective who has been demoted and now walks the beat of the crime infested inner city. It doesn't help that as the movie goes on, the bad guys become more cliched and far too wise as to what exactly is happening. None the less, it's still an entertaining movie.

revenge is probably my favourite film themes and the crow is a great example of a revenge film that is also very touching. The theme of true love even in death is brilliantly portrayed by Brandon Lee and there are some stunning visuals. Part action part gloomy gothic horror romance. 9/10

Review title: A fine effort, but nothing exceptional
Review_body:
Good atmosphere, unique concept. The concept will (obviously) lead to only one end. A superhero, bound to squash the villain's. 
Have added a few turns here and there and given him his weaknesses for his enemies to stand a chance so we get to see a full match. 
May appeal to certain audiences, those looking for something light, who are interested in the genre, fans of the star, i fell a significant part of the fans are the sympathizers. 
But lets face it. This is nowhere among the best films made. My sympathies go out to Lee as well and the movie was fine. But not among the best made, wont figure in the top 30%. A one time watch for a different concept.

Although this movie does not appear to be all that interesting from the cover, the storyline is awesome and completely well-done. The action appears realistic and the drama is sufficient enough to bring tears to the eyes. I definitely encourage anyone to watch this movie and formulate their own opinion of it. It's beautiful (in a dark way), but that doesn't have to be a bad thing all the time. The only thing I keep wondering is why the crow always put himself in danger's way. If he was Eric's strength, he should have kept himself in hiding until he really needed to come out. Many action movies tend to lack in the aspect of drama, but this movie had the right balance of action and drama to keep my interest the whole way through. My best friend, Kristine (sexy4u) showed me this movie, and I loved it so much that it will become a part of my growing movie selection shortly.

Based on the comic book character of the same name, tells a story about a rock musician who comes back from the dead, thanks to an ancient crow and takes his revenge on the people who murdered both him and his fiancee on the night before Mischief Night.While the story is straightforward, the style and it's energy set the tone of the movie perfectly, which makes this the very first comic book movie that's rated R. with awesome characters and good action.While it is sad that Brandon Lee will never live to do another film work in the Hollywood business, at least he gave us him most memorable film of all time.

Review title: A fantastic tale of love and revenge that will never die
Review_body: This movie holds a lot of feelings for me. It was a movie that I shared with a person I loved so much back in the 90s. It's a movie that moved me beyond words. Yeah, you can say it lacks a story, but it delivers on a powerful set of sensations derived mainly from love and despair. I remember going to the movies with my mom and brother (the first time I saw it), and even my mom loved it for it's strength. Then my ex-girlfriend and I turned into our very own movie. We accepted Eric, Sarah and Shelley into our lives, and they became a part of our relationship. This movie speaks so much to you when you're deeply in love, because you feel Eric's loss. Brandon did a great job on this, so did Proyas and everyone involved. There hasn't been another comic book movie like this one, only Spider-man 2. The rest are just action flicks with great sequences.

It has great atmosphere and incredible action sequences. However the actor's are somewhat hammy, (especially in the flashbacks). Overall it's a great action flick with supernatural overtones, but the acting brings it down a notch.The original graphic novel is a work of art, the film just doesn't live up to it.A minor problem I had with it is that there was no original Joy Division song in the movie. A band who's songs were deeply influential to the original story. Instead we get a b********** NIN version to sell the soundtrack. Lame.

Review title: I think I can safely say that THIS IS ONE OF THE BEST MOVIES EVER MADE.
Review_body: In fact, I put it at number 2 on my all-time favorite list.Maybe the film doesn't have a plot. Yeah, so what? Plots suck. It's what happens that's important(You have no idea what I'm talking about, do you?). Anyways, you all know what happens. Dead rock singer comes back to avenge the death of him and his wife. It's very simple. And when it's all that simple and is so darn good, why do you need a plot? It really sucks that Brandon Lee died on the set, this movie really brought out his extraordinary acting talent, that he must have inherited from his father, Bruce. If he were alive today, he would have been a big star because of The Crow.

Review title: As Cool As Superheroes Can Get.
Review_body: I do not read comics so I have never even seen a Crow comic book. I first heard of this movie when Brandon Lee's death was in the news. I was sort of sickened that they would even attempt to finish this movie without him.So I didn't jump the gun and see this movie in the theatres until very late. To my surprise it was a great movie that had an excellent cast, and an excellent soundtrack. Brandon Lee's scenes are moving, perhaps more so when in the back of your mind you know this was his last film. After seeing the finished product I feel it was well done in good taste.

The original author of The Crow comic book has a cameo appearance in the film. In the scene where Eric is under the policeman's gun, the cop is distracted by the sight of people looting the ruins of the burning pawnshop. The camera focuses briefly on a long-haired blond man lugging a television set: that's J. O'Barr, the author!

I was hesitant to watch this movie because a guy I knew in school was infatuated with this movie, and I didn't want to feel gothy for watching it. After i succumbed, I was infatuated as well. It stopped at dressing like the Crow, but I still dug the movie.This movie is one of the few ever made that has everything going for it: tragedy with genuine emotion, incredible style, breath-taking images, hip dialogue, and truly kick-ass action. This is not only one of the very best action movies I've ever seen, it's also a cracking good story.
Every character has personality and style, and the bad guys, while brutal, still manage to be human. One doesn't loose sight of the grittiness of the story. The Crow isn't just taking out the trash, he's risen from the dead to exterminate four human beings. It's not pretty. Not only that, but the Crow has the pleasure of show-casing one of my favorite unknown actors: Michael Wincott, as Top Dollar. No one plays a human reptile as well as Wincott. That slithery, gravely voice sends chills down your spine, I'm upset he didn't get more recognition for this movie.
I also have to hand it to the director, if you read the script for this movie you see the director made some really good choices in filtering a lot of promising but convoluted ideas into a whip-cord of a movie.

It´s a pity that Brandon Lees last movie became a mess like this.I think this movie is boring.It´s so dark sometimes that you can´t see anything.The only thing that is good with this movie is Michael Wincott who plays the bad-guy.I like this kind of movie but this is not one of my favourites.It´s only 4 of 10.

While digging through a box of my video tapes I found The Crow and watched it for the first time in a few years. I can't believe how I could have forgotten such a great movie. And it just sucks that we will never see Brandon Lee do anything else because he was the perfect combination of actor and martial artist. The production design on the film is beautiful along with the cinematography. The music and lighting really set a mood. This is just a fabulous tale of vengeance.

This is a very deep movie. It hardly gets any deeper than this..." If the people we love are stolen from us, the way to have them live on is to never stop loving them. Buildings burn. People die. But real love lives forever. ". And so does Brandon Lee. He fights. He dies. And he lives on in our hearts. In our memories. Forever.

Review title: Kind of an innocent revenge flick.
Review_body: There is something kind of innocent about this film. I still quite enjoyed it. I remember loving and watching it a lot as a teenager. They definitely get the comic book vibe down.There is also something very erie about this being the character that Brandon Lee died playing.

Review title: don't watch this expecting a snuff film (they cut the scene)
Review_body: For a long time I have known of the tragedy that surrounded this film. An actor being killed on set for giving a wooden performance. Harsh but not necessarily unjustified. Films cost millions of dollars and poor acting can completely ruin the finished product. People have been killed for a lot less is all I'm saying. Don't expect to see the famous scene its not in the film and or special features. Disappointing!Now to the film. I found it quite entertaining in parts. Brandon Lee's character was quite a dark hero. The film was quite dark. Not to mention violent. I enjoyed the violence.An interesting observation I had was in the similarities between Brandon Lee's Crow character and Heath Ledger's Joker character. Not just in make up but in performance. I have to wonder whether or not Heath Ledger modeled his Joker on Lee's Crow. One might go as far as saying Ledger modeled everything on Lee. Right down to promoting the film by dying during the production of it. No doubt both films received extra attention due to the star dying before it hit the cinemas.

Review title: A masterpiece of style and theme.
Review_body: The Crow is quite possibly one of the best superhero movies ever made. It is better than the Batman movies(Jack Nicholson notwithstanding), a bit better than Blade, and about as good as the first two Superman movies with Christopher Reeve. Hollywood lost a probable superactor(Brandon's father Bruce preferred the term superactor to superstar) when Brandon was accidently killed. The darkness and incredible set designs, special effects, and characters make this a cinematic classic. All this on a budget of $6 million. Skip the sequel.

One of the best action/horror movies that I've ever seen. Very violent, but very justified in its violence. It probably seems like such a great movie to most because it was Lee's last movie (he died during it's filming). If you like dark characters and movies with anti-heroes...see this movie. Excellent metal/alternative soundtrack as well.

For the horror-movie weakling, this is as dark and gloomy as it gets. Is this a bad thing? ABSOLUTELY NOT!! This movie is fantastic. The photography is incredible, the set design is as fitting as humanly possible, and Brandon Lee makes a surprisingly good undead. Here's the plot line. Eric Draven (Brandon Lee) and his girlfriend/fiancee, Shelley (Sophia Shinas) are the ideal couple with a romance that conquers all-including death. However, the local crime gang interrupts that on halloween (eve or night, I can't remember) and rapes his fiancee. When Eric comes in in the middle of this, he tries to stop them. This gets him thrown out the window and his girlfriend killed. Young, tough, and street-wise Sarah (Rochelle Davis) always looked up to Eric and Shelley, and always imagined them as the caring parents she never had. She can see right through local cop Albrecht (Ernie Hudson) when he says they're going to be OK.However, 1 year later on Halloween  (eve or night) the darkest city I've ever seen in a movie and the local crime gang are in for a surprise. For, Eric Draven, surprise surprise, is back from the grave. Led by a mysterious crow (who the audience can obviously tell holds Eric's soul), Eric finds clothes and makeup to disguise his true identity. He then goes to find revenge on those who took the 2 most precious things to him-his wife and his life. He kills them one by one, now invincible because he is already dead.Each time he leaves some kind of mark in the shape of a crow (A blood painting, and a trail of lit gasoline, etc.) Albrecht vaguely remembers Eric from last Halloween (Eve or night) and meets Eric after his 2nd murder. He and Eric have the hilarious confrontation: "You move and you're dead!!!" "And I say I'm dead...and I move". Whenever anyone meets Eric, he mysteriously dissapears, until Sarah recognizes him from a quote of his and confronts him. After he kills the men he thinks are responsible for last Halloween (eve or night), he meets the real man behind the plan--Top Dollar (Michael Wilcott), who is the leader of the crime gang. Then things start to get interesting. I won't give away the ending. Brandon Lee puts on a great performance, and sadly, his last, as irony entered the situation and when he was supposed to be shot with a blank he was actually shot for real. This is probably the darkest movie I've ever seen that still managed to be a romance. A Must-see (4½ out of 5, 1/2 point off for a little predictability).

Wow what a movie The Crow is.I first saw this movie when i was 10 and my older brother rented it from local video store.I was amazed by it.But strangely enough, i never appreciated it until i was about 15/16.I matured quickly.I had it on video and my machine chewed it up.After a while of searching for it, i found it on DVD cheap in a video store.This is one of the few movies to have everything you could want from a film except sex.This movie has lots of Action,Thrills,Drama,Horror,Excitement,And some one-liners.The scenes are very well filmed and you can feel all of the emotions of Brandon's character.This is rated highly in my all time favourite movies,i have seen a lot of movies over the years including every Bruce and Brandon lee movies ever made.It is tragic that Brandon,like his father before him did not get to enjoy his biggest movie success.The Crow,Rapid Fire and Legacy Of Rage are the top three movies of Brabdon lee in my opinion in that order.Bruce would be Enter The Dragon,Fists Of Fury,and The Big Boss.Brandon like his father before him died to soon.But Bruce and Brandon will forever be remembered for The Crow and Enter The Dragon.I would recommend this movie for anyone who wants an all in one film,This has it all.R.I.P Bruce and Brandon.Gone too soon.

Review title: Everyone needs to see this movie.
Review_body: Putting aside the tragedy surrounding the movie, this really is a must see. The soundtrack is amazing, the score is perfect and the story line is one everyone can empathise with . I've seen this so many times I know the script by heart. Beautiful, moving, exciting and wonderfully choreographed there's something for everyone here. x

This is was one of the coolest, greatest movies ever made.  This is going to be a classic.  And it's not just that it has a Gothic setting that makes it so intriguing.  The acting is superb.  Every actor and actress in this film put their best effort in the making of this movie.Caution: might be spoilers ahead'The Crow' is a simple story about a guy who comes back from the dead to avenge the death of his fiancee.  He searches the city for the men responsible for her death and as long as the crow that guides him throughout the city remains unharmed, he is invincible.  The key performances are Brandon Lee as Eric Draven and Michael Wincott as Top Dollar.  David Patrick Kelly, Rochelle Davies, Bai Ling, and the men who play Tin Tin, Skank, Funboy, the cop, and the pawnshop owner are also riveting.  Every kill Eric Draven makes is creative, and just about every line that comes out of Top Dollar's mouth makes you laugh.  The songs are great.  The only part about it I didn't get (I think they explained this but I didn't catch it) was the part about Bai Ling's character being Top Dollar's sister.  Anyway, the reason why I think this is the best material to come out of cinema is because this is a simple plot twisted into a haunting, action-packed tale that will end with you feeling happy about renting it and very sad that Brandon Lee died during the filming.

This movie was very bad AZZ! IT kicked AZZ! Even though Lee died during the making of the Crow, IT was one of his best movies. It was fast paced, had an interesting premise, and excellent special effects. With a great costume design for Lee. The liitle was a treat to watch, as well as the entire cast. I recommend this great thriller. **** out of ****

I watched this movie in my video collection. For starters, Brandon Lee was about 29 years old when he died on the set, so young and influential like his Father Bruce Lee who is arguably the first Action Hero, because no doubt in my mind if Brandon lived on, he not only would have been the most talented, successful Actor taking over Johnny Depp, but he would be the most independent Actor in his own rite. Plus, I cannot believe this movie is not older than it is!! Made in 1994 and it still looks great, absolutely Timeless, if it was released in the box office beyond the threshold of the year 2K , the sales would hit the roof, and here is why: The music score is brilliantly composed by Graeme Revell, who also done Child's Play 2 and Bride of Chucky, and the electric Guitar sound during the fighting scenes sores up your adrenal glands and gets them pumping.The Style of the comic strip super hero is a Mosher; the twisted Gothic look that now inspires trends due to the like of Marilyn Manson, and most black metal bands that are appealing at this particular time even as I speak! That is why I am accounting that this movie is beyond it's time.Set on Devil's Night 30 October, Hangman's Noose front man musician, Eric Draven suitably played by Brandon Lee, and beautiful fiancée Shelley Webster were ready for their big day on Hallowe'en Night, but tragedy came when Shelley was Raped and beaten by vicious and invective Gang members by the names of Tin Tin, Skank, T-bird etc. Eric walks in unexpectedly and was beaten, shot and thrown from the window as he plummets a 100 feet below to his death. A cool-headed cop wonderfully played by Ernie Hudson of Hand that rocks the Cradle, and Ghostbusters fame is in charge of the case, breaks the news to 12 year old lonely Sarah who narrates the story in the Movie.Exactly one year later, with a help of a Crow, Eric Draven rose from his grave and become the psychopathic avenger, but he puts his insanity into good use to stalk the Gang one-by-one, turns Tin Tin into a "Voodoo doll", T-bird into a moving flame grilled Whopper burger, and the crack head one that "feels like a worm on a big fvcking hook" known as Skank gets a plunge from the Window and ritualistically leaves an outlined symbol of a Crow at the scene. The head leader of the Gang is Top Dollar (Michael Wincott), his half-Sister who have more than a consanguineous relationship (yep! you guessed it!) along with his comrade Tony Todd (Candyman) as they ploy and find out that a welcomed guest who has come back from the dead to greet them, has a weakness to be human by killing the Crow that guides him and to destroy Eric to allure him by kidnapping Sarah. It is up to Eric to go against all odds to save the captive Sarah and finally rest in peace.I enjoyed Superhero movies like Batman, Spiderman 1 and 2, but they lacked the witty, dark humor that realistically reflects the heart of the chaotic society where scruples don't apply, and the dialogue resembles Quentin Tarantino Style that is compared to DUSK TIL DAWN, and it is a clever movie about a deceased Victim that becomes a deadly vigilante with a scary presence in an anti-hero sense that irritates the law, unlike a geek that gets bitten by a spider, or an embodiment of a poor little orphan dressed as a bat.Better than Batman and Spidey, You are damn right!

Review title: Not dead, just too embarrassed to go out in public again
Review_body: While watching this I decided that Brandon Lee's death must be a hoax. He isn't really dead, just too embarrassed to out in public again. This whole movie is just awful. Though, I suppose the two dimensional nature of everything about the film can be traced back to its comic origins, but what's the point of making a live action film if it's going to be thinner than the paper the original story was printed on? I'd like to see a prequel detailing the rise to power of the Hell Night leader despite his position as leader seeming completely arbitrary. I got the feeling that the soundtrack sold the movie. Grunge heads went to see it because their heroes' music was in it and must have loved it because of that. Can't recommend even for a casual view, really. Total waste of time IMO.

The Crow was a movie of poetry, melancholy, and darkness. When most people hear the name Brandon Lee, they think "The Crow" after all, it was his last performance in cinematic history. An All time favorite.To those who have seen it often experience the Sadness that was carried with the film, and what is kind of ironic about this movie dealing with life and death is the fact that Brandon Lee was killed during this movie.I consider this movie to be an independent film, yet it still hit theaters and was rewarded as a beautiful masterpiece. The crow is not a movie to see for entertainment (though it is HIGHLY entertaining and is also considered a classic), this is a movie to experience.Reading what many others have said about The Crow, it has touched them in so many ways, as well as myself.I advise everyone to go see this movie who hasn't.

First off, Brandon Lee's performance. This movie couldn't have been what it was without him. It's all the more tragic that he died during filming as the man certainly had some talent which might have been able to grow more. Watching him in The Crow brings conflicting emotions to the surface; you sympathize with his violent death and vengeful existence, yet he is absolutely ruthless and sadistic in exacting punishment on his executioners.The depressed look of the city where it is constantly raining can be slightly overbearing at times, but still does an admirable job of conveying the melancholy of the environment. The supporting cast does a fine job also, even the child actor avoids being irritating.Overall, definitely one of the better comic book adaptions of the 1990s.

Review title: One of my favorite movies of all time.
Review_body: I can't say enough about this film. It is one of my all-time favorite films. After reading the comic book by James O'Barr, I eagerly anticipated the arrival of this film (thanks for letting me borrow your copies of the comic book, Matt!). What a pity Brandon Lee was killed midway through production...I would have loved to see more of his work. The dark nature of the film and its hero might not appeal to everyone, but for me it was right on the money. I find the movie fascinating and moving every time I view it. Yes, I said "moving" because I can feel the hero's pain and torment. Hey, how would you feel after coming back from the dead to avenge the murder of your one true love? As far as comic-book-to-big-screen adaptations go, this one gets the mood and feel of the original comics perfect. Great film. If you only see one "Crow" film, see this one. All others are pale imitations of this film's greatness.

THE SOUNDTRACK, THE DIALOGUE, THE DARKNESS, THE ACTION, THE ACTING, THE DIRECTING... EVERYTHING IS PERFECTLY DONE. THIS MASTERPIECE WILL ALWAYS BE TIMELESSBrandons impeccable acting skills blow me away everytime....most comic book movies the character has a robot face the entire time. But in THE CROW eric has a massive wide range of emotions and facial expressions...u can see the hurt in his eyes and face and the anger and devastation.,.especially when he infects the main villain with shelly's 30 hours of pain... he was dead but had more humanity in his character than any other movie i've seen. Even in the belly of darkness and misery he found a blissful joy through the echo of the laugh of children in the street if only for a minute.... this movie is gut wrenching cuz it has alot of heart and soul... r.i.p brandon lee ...unforgettable performance.

I don't actually watch many movies more then once but The Crow is actually one of the few movies I've seen more than once. I genuinely like the movie for several reasons. I find this to be one of the best revenge tales I've ever seen. Unlike almost all other revenge flicks I've seen this one works because the characters are likable. The theme of the movie is actually tied into the unfortunate death of Brandon Lee. It also manages to capture the atmosphere of the Grunge craze that happened in the 90s. The best part about it though is that the movie manages to pull all of this off and still not seem dated. Even though I only saw this movie twice it felt better watching it the second time around rather then the first. I also like the movie more then the Comic even though the comic is solid as well.

This movie is a gorgeous cinematic masterpiece that everyone should view. Though dark and Gothic this movie resembles such terrific and strong emotion and is centered around a romantic theme as Brandon Lee exacts revenge against the ruthless band of criminals who murdered him and his fiancée after being revived from a hypnotic crow. Review title: The comments saying it's a good adaptation...
Review_body: of the comic must have been written by people who haven't read the comic.*Possible* spoilers...When the producers adapted the comic to the movie, they left behind the core of the character. The major characteristic that made The Crow who he was. To describe the revenant of Eric Draven requires only one word: laconic. He was an avenging angel who said very little, and that was a big part of what made him so terrifying to his victims. He appears and they recognize him. He doesn't say much. He doesn't really seem angry. He just, calmly, proceeds to extract the full measure of justice they deserve. Nothing they do can stop him. This is the definition of a revenant. Someone who has died so wrongly that their spirit remains in the earthly plane with a single driving purpose (in this case, vengeance). Nothing diverts the revenant from that purpose and it's damn near impossible to stop it from accomplishing said purpose.Making all those long-winded speeches is, simply, something that a revenant would not do. There is no need and it distracts from the purpose.So. Go back and read the comic, it's better than the movie (which, with 2 exceptions, is always the case). It's not a bad movie, it just doesn't do justice to the source.4 of 10.

Review title: One of the deepest movies of all time.
Review_body: This movie is my favorite film of all time. One factor of this film that made it so awesome had to be the casting. The acting is just superb. Brandon Lee did an excellent job of playing Eric Draven, one of the most complicated comic book characters ever. I don't think there's any actor out there that could've mastered this role like Brandon Lee did. Michael Wincott fit Top Dollar's personality so well. He can be so evil at times. The soundtrack and the score were masterpieces in themselves. All the bands chosen to appear ( ex. Stone Temple Pilots, Nine Inch Nails)on the soundtrack had a certain mood to their music that fit the movie's aura. As for the score, Graeme Revell put together perhaps one of the best scores of the 1990's. With his combination of modern musical instruments and foreign instruments and his tasteful and original use of synthesizers, he will always be one of the most talented composers. The plot of this film is so universal. it can be used on so many other levels or in so many other stories. Being brought back from the dead not to avenge yourself, but to avenge the death of your loved one. Some may think that it's cliche but this coming from the same people who watch movie like Robo Cop and think that that is good movie-making. ::shudder:: Others believe that the movie became popular for the fact that Brandon Lee passed away during the making of it. I don't think this could be farther from the truth. The movie would be just as popular as it is today even if Brandon Lee had not died during the fabrication of the film. Though the sequels that followed the film fell short of it's greatness, they will never tarnish the importance of The Crow. James O' Barr put together a story of anger, pain, and love and Alex Proyas turned his vision into a masterpiece. This movie changed my life...

What a classic! Dark and disturbing but with an undercurrent of hope throughout. A crow is his link between life and afterlife.The Crow is a cold film but occasionally the young girl brings some warmth to the screen in particular when She becomes friends with a police officer and when her Mother cleans up and starts caring.The villains are pure evil. Of course they all die and there is a happy ending for the girl and her mother. How sweet.8/10 for this which is 2 points more than my Matrix rating. The taste of revenge, the dark corners, the black everywhere, the night, and a crow that fly, seeking revenge, seeking death for the murderers of a girl and a boy. "The Crow" is a masterpiece. A sad, dark and violent fable of revenge and death bought by a black bird that, sometimes, takes back to life the victims of brutal murderer so they can have they holy revenge. The movie is a little different from the original graphic novel written by James O.Barr. The novel is beautiful and my advice is to read it as soon as you can if you loved the movie. This film also remind the tragic death of Brandon Lee. Brandon was incredible acting as "the Crow". The other two movies are simply awful and cannot bring to life the spirit within the original, incredible, novel. This is an angry movie on the side of the victims. The Crow is one of my favorites of all time. The cinematography, dialogue, soundtrack, acting, etc...All phenomenal.

Review title: true to the original cult strip as it can get
Review_body: Finally after so many years the movie was made (1994) the special dvd came out, and of course I had to posses it. On this dvd there is an interesting interview with the original cartoonist of the Crow. He tells he's proud the director really listened to him to make it as darkish as possible, even bleach out colors to make it this gothic crow world. The soundtrack (The Cure, Stone Temple Pilots), the cast, the director, to the last person just exquisite.PS I only approve to this movie to be THE CROW. The sequels aren't even worth watching. I cannot understand how they could screw up the excellent original. And the tragedy that happened during the making of this movie: Brandon Lee got shot with a real bullet instead of blanks.How could this happen? Same as to Bruce Lee, his legendary father? a shame to the film industry this is.

The Crow showcased the prodigious talents of Brandon Lee, who with out doubt would have forged his own considerable identity with this film had he not been tragically killed. A very stylish film throughout, this film established the dark brooding style that rocketed The Matrix into international success. Lee is magnificent as the reborn Eric Draven, although a little more martial arts from him would have been appreciated. Michael Wincott also turns in a great performance as the villainous Top Dollar, delivering his lines with gutteral precision and evil. Stylish costumes, lighting and cinematography complement the fantastic action sequences and fine acting perfectly, to create a truly excellent film. 8 out of 10.

There was nobody else that could've played this like Lee played it...he truly was sent from Heaven to play this role...before he died. Yes, his death was tragic, all the more tragic considering the movie and the source material (ironic is a better word.) This is one of the greatest movies of the 1990's, and anyone who claims otherwise is sadly mistaken. As with most decades, it is the smaller cult films that take the cake. Clerks, Pulp fiction, The Matrix (although bigger budget), and the crow are on the list of the ten best movies of the 1990's. A ten year span and one of the best? 13 years later (almost) and still a classic? Yes it stands the test of time. Brandon Lee rules.

Review title: I guess Brandon Lee saved the Best for the Last
Review_body: Until recently I did not had the privilege to watch this cult classic but I must confess I was not hoping much out of it as the main star cast included a one certain Brandon Lee. But as the movie went on I realized that Brandon was truly one fine actor who before this one was not given adequate script to work on.This is a kind of movie one should gift another or even keep in his own personal collection. The cinematography was excellent and action was brilliant as did not posses that high flying gravity defying martial arts instead it was more natural.The acting is brilliant, Brandon Lee was simply superb shame that he died during filming this motion picture, I guess god is not fair in certain aspects. Rochelle Davis as a teenager was awesome, pity that she didn't featured in any other movie after this. Ernie Hudson & Michael Wincott were very good in their respectable roles, Bai Ling was perhaps the only one who was wrongly cast.The story is great and the overall package was not only entertaining but also enterprising. I would give it an eight out of ten but simply because of Brendon it gets nine out of ten. Do watch this movie as it will surely deliver to your expectations.

I was reluctant to watch it for most of my life and finally decided I couldn't ignore the hype I'd heard for so many years.I really just could not see the point to this movie or any redeeming qualities.
