It was talked about, parodied and the subject of many a Halloween costume - but it always eluded me.Finally, 26 years after it was released, I finally watched it - and I was not disappointed.Based on the comic book series of the same name, the film bursts straight out of the gates and we find main character and rock musician Eric already dead. He has been murdered during a home invasion by sadistic thugs, and his fiancee succumbs to the same fate shortly after.Eric, with the mysterious and spiritual aid of a crow, rises from the dead and methodically goes about exacting revenge on the ones responsible for the cruel slayings.I thought this was a great movie. It was melodramatic, fast-paced and action packed. Not to mention a very punchy dialogue.Every character had its place, and every place had character - a true comic book movie. Of course the film is known for being Brandon Lee's swansong and, although I am no expert on Brandon, what a marvellous performance it was. Not over the top, but perfectly black and white just as the role demanded.The dark and gothic backdrop perfectly sets the scene for the story, and the crow motif gives this revenge movie a marvellously poetic dimension (allusion's are even made Edgar Allan Poe's 'The Raven').Overall - fun, exciting and thoroughly satisfying.

Review title: Not a brooding, dark Gothic masterpiece. Just bad.
Review_body: Yes, I know of its origins in comic book land, but that doesn't mean the characters have to be two-dimensional. Cardboard villains and heroes. Idiotically simple-minded revenge plot. Absolutely no suspense or tension because you know Brandon Lee's character is invincible.The crow-raven conflation is silly ("rapping, rapping at my chamber door" etc.) Why not make the bird a freaking raven instead of a crow if you want to reference Poe?And the goth-rock setting is equally moronic. (Everyone knows that all Goths are pussies and afraid of any violence other than to themselves.) Brandon Lee putting on his Robert Smith makeup after rising from the dead just made me laugh out loud.I don't understand the reviewers lauding the "atmospheric" / "beautifully shot" / etc. cinematography. The whole thing looks like a cheesy 90s MTV video.I could go on. This is probably the worst movie I've seen in the last year...or more.

what a great movie i watched today . The Crow . I had read the novel i like that so much Now i saw this movie its brilliant , it is awesomeLike i said novel it is great work done by John O'Barr . Now movie is is very good adoptedThe acting of Brandon Lee is awesome , all the fight scenes , martial arts , everything is awesome . i feel sad for Brandon Lee that he died . R.I.Pi also like the little girl Rochelle Davis who played Sarah , Her acting is good This film is very good directed an screen played . i like the way story is moving along and all this supernatural thing , It inspires me a lotI had fun watching this movie

I know most people watch this movie expecting to see a kick ass action flick....and it doesn't disappoint either, but that's not what makes this movie so great...and it's damn sure not what makes it my all time favorite. First I have to admit a few things...I am a hopeless romantic..and am fascinated with the possibility of life after death...so when the movie came along that tossed those two elements in together and mixed them up I got to say I was completely jazzed to see it. Though I gotta' admit that I was kind of regretting it too because it was a comic book movie. Luckily it wasn't the typical comic book film. This flick is the most romantic movie ever made...it shows us that a love can be so strong and powerful that one will even refuse death to be held in the arms of that loved one again. That someone can be so passionate in their lives that they will forego their eternal peace and face eternal damnation just to get revenge on those that would harm the love of their lives. The Crow could have floundered had it not been for the wonderfully soul-wrenching performance of the late Brandon Lee, he truly makes you feel the passion that his character must have felt. Brandon just seems like someone who would say to hell with death you hurt my fiance.  I really can't seem to heap enough praise on this film so I will quit rambling now and allow you to go see this for yourself and fall in love again.

This has got to be, without a doubt, one of the best films I've ever seen. I've always loved horror films, and this one has got to be my favorite.  The special effects, the action, and the gothic-ness of it, make it one to watch over and over again.This is a must have!  Really spectacular!

As far as this boy is concerned, The Crow is one of the greatest films ever created.  It was the first movie I owned, and the first one I ever fell for. The Crow is an intense, dark ride into the subconscious.  Yeah, it sounds cheesey, but I have yet to find a person who can watch this movie and disagree.  There's just something about it; the story, the vengeance, whatever.  Whatever it is, it is beautiful.

This is one of my favourite films; I've seen it when I was 16 and it gave me a lot of emotions.This film is "gothic"; ligth and sun never appears.The scenes are all dark and rainy.Music are very powerful and ideal to give the idea of chaos.Sometimes you can't understand what's happen because it is too dark.Note the scenes where Eric realizes his crows.

I've always known this is a classic horror movie but I was avoiding watching it because I thought it might be tacky.The crow didn't disappoint. It's stylistic and moral plot is great. The crow becomes a likable and relatable character for every kind honest man who loves a beautiful woman.Although the film is a little cliche at times, this little bit of cliche seems to add to the horror metal kitsch that makes the film a cult classic.This film is a must watch for any cult film or horror film enthusiast! It's good for an easy night in and a good one to watch with your partner. Although spoilers you partner has to have an open mind about what a relationship film can be. Maybe not want to show on the first date.

This is a must see movie for all of you, who loves dark "thrilling" ride kind of movies! This movie has everything, great characters, geat acting, very nice camera work, action scenes kicks butt (maybe one of the best I have ever seen)... I can go on and on!!!If you want to be entertained next weekend, watch this movie. Believe me, you won't be disappointed!

This movie kicked butt.  It reminded me of all those mid-eighties comics where suddenly all the superheroes were turning psychotic, like the Punisher or Vigilante or the Dark Knight Returns.  The original Batman tried to be like that, but IMHO failed.  I enjoyed this a lot more, even though it's a smaller movie with a less well-known hero.  Check it out.

This film has always been in the back of my mind as one of the greats. One of those must see films that I just hadn't got around to watching yet. So I made a point of watching it. Oh dear. Don't get me wrong, I wanted to like this film, I gave it the benefit of the doubt considering it's age and the hype surrounding it but it was dreadful. In my opinion, if Lee hadn't died tragically during the making if this film then it would probably have gone straight to DVD and I wouldn't have just sat through an hour and half of dross.

the crow is such a great movie, it fills your heart with more anger, depression, sorrow, faith and hope than any emo song could ever imagine to capture. it's a wonderfully made film. absolutely gripping. it brings me to tears just thinking about it...SUCH A GREAT MOVIE! AHHHHH!

i remember i was in college when i first heard of this movie. I had to go through quite a few video shops to get my hand on a decent VHS tape but boy oh boy was i blown way with this flick. The dark atmosphere coupled with a banging soundtrack makes it a proper cult classic. Who can forget the scene when Brandon lee is standing at the window looking at the town with The Crow's 'Burn' track in the backdrop. It is one of cinema's most hallucinating scenes yet the movie never got the status it deserved when it got released. With time people will discover this cult classic and rediscover themselves with it. The soundtrack in its own is another classic,filled with big names like The Cure, Nine inch nails,violent femmes, panthera etc, it sure is a soundtrack to blow you away.

Review title: The greatest movie of all time.
Review_body: This is my absolute, hands-down favorite of all time. Brandon Lee gave a phenomenal performance, portraying the immense pain and anguish of a man who had his true love taken from him and then was murdered.Eric Draven is one of the most emotionally deep characters of all time. He drives through the plot with such power and momentum, never letting the adrenaline slow. If you want to see a true artist performing a true work of art, watch Brandon Lee in The Crow. Any artist can recognize the beauty of Brandon Lee's work here. Just like his father, Brandon Lee has mastered the artless art. It is a tragedy that this was to be his final work.In addition to Brandon Lee's amazing mastery of Eric Draven, Michael Wincott is incredible as Top Dollar, the villainous leader of the gang infamous for beginning the tradition of Devil's Night.The Crow is also full of memorable scenes, and quotes. "It can't rain all the time." became a household phrase among my friends and anyone familiar with the scene will know why I adore "Mother is the name for God on the lips and hearts of all children."

Review title: Great Movie, Great Acting,Great soundtrack, Awesome visuals!
Review_body: I would say this has to be the best movie I have even viewed, everything about it is just brilliant I'm a big fan of the crow, however not sure about the sequels maybe its because of the death of Brandon as so not being able to take to the role once more I'm not sure.The visuals on the city and that Gothic feel are just brilliant you really feel IN that city like its real, the words in the script are also just perfect from start to finish, an unmissable movie, buy the double disk SE version on DVD NOW you wont be disappointed.i wont include the story as it already explains about that on the page! if anyone wants to talk to me about the crow movie or any of its stars or exchange cool crow website they have found, about the movie , Brandon's death etc email me @ miyagigoose@hotmail.com

Review title: One of the best films i have ever seen. Period.
Review_body: This film is marvelous, The Story is about Life, Death, Revenge, and Justice. Brandon Lee gives the most thrilling final performance of all time before his death on set on March 31, 1993 from a gunshot wound. The Crow is one of my favorite films next to director Alex Proyas other film, Dark City (1998). Its sad that Brandon Lee died, but remains a legend to this day. A+. 10/10

There is a tacit theme of sadness that is so ubiquitous throughout the entire movie that it should have been billed as the main character. It's raised to the next level when you remember that this was Brandon Lee's breakout movie and he died making it. I never read the comic so I do not know if it was true to it, but I do know that this movie had a tone that I've never felt before. Brandon Lee is simply amazing! The set design, writing, and directing are top notch--they truly transport you to the goth underbelly of a place you don't want to be. It will clearly be too violent and dark for many viewers, but if you can get over it, you will experience a brilliant film. i've seen this movie a few times and it gets better every time I see it. My only complaint is that I did not have the luxury of seeing it in a theater.

This movie is my all time favorite. Everything in this movie is perfectly done, from the cast (especially Michael Wincotts and Ernie Hudsons performances, not to forget the best performance in the career of the late Brandon Lee)to the camera, which creates the sombre atmosphere for the story and the perfectly fitting soundtrack (check out the cures "burn", which even I, as a non-fan of this band, love. I can't but just praise every single picture shown and every line spoken in this movie. Maybe the plot is a little stereotype ( a Victim of a brutal murder, returns from the dead to avenge his death an the death of his fiancée), but as a modern fairy tale this movie has an excuse for having a quite well-known story-line. The only thing that lowers the enjoyment of this movie, is the tragic death of Brandon Lee.

The Crow is such a beautiful movie, Brandon Lee's performance was spectacular. It's a shame Brandon is no longer with us, but he will always be a legend in my book. The Crow is a classic, very underrated. I do not enjoy the sequels to the movie, they should have stopped after this movie. Without Eric Draven there is no crow.

I think this is one of the best movies ever cause it has a special feeling in it. You can almost feel the pain and sorrow from Eric Draven (Brandon Lee). He's playing great and that he (Lee) died suddenly was tragic and then you have to see his last movie.

Review title: This would have made Brandon a star
Review_body: This movies would have made Brandon Lee a huge star. The acting in this movie is excellent, the camera work is unbelieveable (especially form the crow's view) and Lee is flat out awesome. Too bad his life was cut short making this movie. The Crow is a dark journey into the (after) life of Eric Draven, who returns to avenge the death of his himself and his wife. The movie is great and so was Lee.

Review title: A real fever dream of a movie
Review_body: 'The Crow' is neither original nor easy to watch, but persist and you will find it to be one of the best movies around.  Themes of love, death, and revenge feature heavily, and there is a lot of violence, urban decay, and very little sunlight (not good for those of you who find dark movies hard to watch).Every aspect of 'The Crow' oozes quality: Alex Proyas' fantastic directing (a more visually stunning movie you will not find), the stunning performances by the late Brandon Lee and the menacing Michael Wincott, the fabulous sound track, the brilliant scripting ... I could go on forever.The movie does have its faults though.  There are probably not enough flashback scenes of Eric Draven and Shelly Webster in better times, and there are a few inconsistencies in the plot, but these are minor quibbles and do not detract from an otherwise excellent movie.'The Crow' is going to be either one of two things for the first time viewer: an amazing experience, or your worst nightmare.Whether for you it's amazing or a nightmare, 'The Crow' has succeeded in its aim.

Review title: A great film! My favourite currently.
Review_body:
I'm not really a big movie fan but I remember a time when I was about 15 and I saw this film on Channel 4 on a sunday night. I sat there, knowing full well that I had school the next morning, and watched the film end to end... To say I was impressed would be an understatement.Since then I have seen the film at least 50 times (i long since stopped counting) and each time I enjoy it.The plot is a basic justice for victims affair based on the graphic novel by James O'barr.I can barely fault this film, the sets, acting (Brandon Lee's finest moment - Rest in Piece Brandon), screen play and directing are virtually flawless.
The soundtrack has some great songs on it and the films score is moving.If you have a couple of hours free watch this film.10 out of 10 for me

Brandon Lee becomes The Crow. No, he IS The Crow. He died for this role, and he was so in to it, he became the role of Eric. No one else could play this role and the sequels are just a waste of time.The actual film is one of the fine examples of action films in the nineties but I think that the most important thing is the love factor. The love portrayed between Shelly and Eric is excellent.
One of my all time favorite movies. I wish Brandon Lee was still with us. They'll never be able to reboot this classic!

This is one of the most underappreciated movies I know. I'm glad that most IMDb voters share my opinion (look at the ratings). The Crow is one of the best movies of all time, if you ask me. It may have it's technical weaknesses, but the athmosphere it creates and sustains is just breathtaking. Shelly Webster's speeches cause me to have goosebumps all over my back whenever I watch this movie. I'm glad that they finished this movie despite the tragedy about Brandon Lee (RIP). Definitely a great movie!

Of the many reviews here, I found that far too few mention the astounding resourcefulness of director Alex Proyas; yes, Brandon Lee was good (note: Michael Wincott was better), yes there is a gleeful amount of menacing action and, surprisingly, some well-rounded characters and bits of clever dialogue, as opposed to the pun-filled Batman Returns (and should go away again)...but considering the fact that this film cost 6 million dollars to make-the cheapest of the Burton/Schumacher Batman films cost 80 million-and that it maintained a level of frenetic energy to rival, and often succeed, any of the Batman films is a testament to his ability. I agree with most of what was already said here: better than average comic-adaptation with a script that doesn't go out of its way to insult the intelligence of its audience, a tragic, pensive mood prevalent throughout a story that could have easily evolved into a revenge epic ala Chuck Bronson...but the fact it was done for six million dollars is truly staggering-Proyas should have a sizeable bulk of Hollywood eating out of his hand for how well he can stretch a budget. Added note: 'Hannibal' costs 87 million; hopefully this puts Proyas achievement into perspective.

Review title: A great movie, with a great performance by the late Brandon Lee!
Review_body: The Crow is a great movie, and the performance Brandon Lee gave is remarkable.  It is so sad that he died making this movie, as this movie would have boosted him into stardom.  The Crow is action packed, and even has comic moments throughout the movie.  Everytime I watch this movie I think about how Brandon Lee was killed making this movie, and it makes me sad.  Seeing his character's grave is almost foreshadowing real life. Unfortunately unlike in the movie, in real life Brandon Lee will never be back.  The Crow is a great movie, and I recommend any person to watch it. The Crow is a definite 10 out of 10!
An amazing movie with great acting. I have seen this movie many times and would watch it again
This movie is one of the best movies to have been ever made ever. Everything about this movie is absolutely amazing. This movie is beautiful and may Brandon Lee rest in peace.

This film shot to fame before release due to the untimely death of Brandon Lee.  Subsequently it was launched to a frenzy of media hype, and I avoided it like the plague.Well, 6 years later I was finally persuaded to watch it.  Brilliant. Fantastic.  It's funny, fast and loud, dark, moody and violent (but stylishly violent).  I wish I'd seen it in the cinema in the first place.Don't ask why it's good - just watch it and see.Now if someone could arrange a widescreen transfer for Region2 DVD?

"...as of someone gently rapping, rapping at my chamber door.  You heard me rapping, right?"  This movie is definitely the best possible piece of filmmaking on this planet(moment of silence for the "late, great" Brandon Lee)! SPOILERS LIE AHEAD... Here's the low-down.  A rock-guitarist named Eric Draven (Lee) and his fiance Shelly Webster are murdered by Top Dollar's gang on Devil's Night, the night before their wedding.  One year later, he is ressurected by a crow to seek vengence upon those who caused his death and bring the killers to justice.  The darkness/goth of this film is the key to commiting it to memory.  Who can forget a man strolling the streets of a post-apoclyptic Detroit wearing black and white make-up(NOT FACEPAINT)and a trenchcoat? Not any sane human.  The action in this movie is also fantastic, although scarce, but what this movie lacks in action, it makes up for ten-fold in plot.  The sequels were interesting all in their own, but the original bakes its own cake.  Once again, kudos to Lee for a fantastic finale, and to Alex Proyas for creating the best movie the world has ever seen.Acting:10/10 Action:9/10 Plot:10/10 Music:10/10 Set:11/10(yes, it was that good) Overall rating for The Crow:10/10          MUST SEE!!!!!!!!

The Crow is one of those "Top Five" comic-to-film adaptations that has, proudly, won a perfect score. Not only Brandon Lee is amazing in what came to be his swan song, but also brings a more than flawless performance that will stay in the minds of cinema-lovers for years to come.I never peeked "The Crow" comic book, neither knew who created it. I just saw "The Crow" under recommendation of my girlfriend who found it the most beautiful film on earth. The Gothic aesthetics portrayed on screen are extremely accurate and the Montecristo's sense of vengeance make this a "justified" Action/Sci-Fi Drama film. Brandon Lee parted ways leaving behind him a movie that has to be claimed whether you're a comic book fan or not, the now remembered phrase: "Nothing is Trivial" has almost become a myth. The Visual Effects deployed in it are way too unreal, surreal; to the point of believing yourself in a black, but beautiful, nightmare. The environments, the facial-uplifting, the stunts and explosions seem to come from a 22nd Century motion picture. The Crow has surpassed the many boring blockbusters that have been bombarding us for the past few years.Cerebral, dramatic, fantastic and surreal are the words that can, closely, describe this wonder. Forget the sequels, see this as a one-chance opportunity to see the true meaning of your own life. And remember: It Can't Rain All The Time...

This movie played an important part in my youth, how I grew up... at the time I saw The Crow, it was the most cathartic thing for me--Eric Draven kicked the arses of all that had done wrong, sure, the movie's bullies and criminals, but also my school bullies and the general cruelty of life.Apart from Brandon Lee's mesmerising acting, his swansong now tarnished by numerous ripoff sequels and the like, Michael Wincott gives his best as the true embodiment of evil, Top Dollar; the character that was black and white in more ways than one on the page came to life and was pure blackness, pure dark evil. Thanks to that one fantastic--and very underrated--actor, who I still cherish in my personal top ten of screen performers.So, my ten stars are out of sentimental value, but also personal taste--never was a revenge tale so beautifully told, never so uplifting, never... holding so much *hope* in the eventual sunshine--that "it can't rain all the time."

The first time I saw The Crow was around 1996, when I was about 14 years old, had no idea what "goth" means and wasn't yet very seriously into metal music. This movie left me trembling, sitting on the couch with my mouth open and tears in my eyes. I couldn't stand up in at least half an hour! It was something totally new for me. No movie had affected me that way before and it took years before anything similar happened.Well, now seven years older and still not into almost anything that can be classified as "gothic" (goths do wear some nice clothes though) - and still The Crow has the same effect on me. There are some other movies that affect me very strongly, but The Crow is different - it was the first one. It's no longer the best movie I've seen - the third or fourth best probably - but anyway it was the first, and that's why it may always be 'special' for me. I hope so.The plot of the movie isn't very interesting - actually pretty corny. Apparently it doesn't prevent from making one hell of a movie experience. Alex Proyas did a marvellous job. The movie's got everything. The overall atmosphere of it is just beyond description. The soundtrack is great, too - even though I listen to a bit different kind of music normally.Brandon Lee is superb as Eric Draven, and I love also Rochelle Davis as Sarah. But as usually, Michael Wincott - as Top Dollar - steals the show with one of his best performances ever. For me, Top Dollar is a very significant part of the fascination about this movie. He's not just plain bad - he's got a sense of humour just like mine. Plus there's some kind of deep inexplicable sadness about him, which makes me confused: should I hate him or not? He's the bad guy, so I probably should, but... - And this is just one of the strange feelings this movie awakes in me.What a totally amazing movie.

Review title: "there all dead...they just don't no it yet"
Review_body: A masterful classic thriller of a film can describe the Crow, a intense and in ways very brutal film. a huge fan of this film and for me a favorite, a film like this can never get repeated although the death of Brandon lee a huge tragedy for the film in many ways helped it to succeed. Eric Draven a very mysterious character coming back from the dead to revenge those who have done him beautifully played by Lee, and a performance no one will ever be able to repeat. i was always on the edge of my seat when watching this film. my favorite scene has to be when Eric is sitting on the curb and Albrecht arrives to try and arrest him.The Film it self i believe had a great perfect story behind it, one that was portrayed to a huge success the use of sound and lighting gave the film a very real feel to it and a instant classic that will never b repeated.

I really enjoyed this film even though it's full of violence and gore which I'm not really into and I couldn't tell who was playing the part of Eric Draven as it always looked like Brandon Lee, I couldn't point out when he was replaced by a different actor but apparently the actress that played Sarah only came back to do one more scene after Brandon was no longer there then didn't star in the rest of the film. It was well done, except from his father's film Game of Death when the editing to it look like Bruce Lee was still in the film was badly done and shouldn't have went ahead with it's release. I heard Brandon's fiancée didn't want the release of The Crow to go ahead after what happened to him. They were both great men that I would've liked to meet and hope they're at peace. I'm sure all fans will agree, here's to Bruce and Brandon Lee ;-) *

I cannot possibly say enough about this film!  The story is one of romance and vengence.  It is visually appealing with its stylized view of what evil can do when it overruns an area.  Brandon Lee's performance is the best have ever seen in a film.  This is the type of film that once you have watched it, it sticks with you.

Review title: One of the best love stories ever
Review_body: I think that "The Crow" is one of the best romantic movies ever to be made for the theatre. Though dark, it carries and embodies a romance that cannot be mistaken for violent or even inhumane situations. This movie by far is one of the best love stories ever written and it was truly sad to see that Brandon is no longer with us.

Review title: Imitation is the sincerest form of flattery.
Review_body: Stealing visual style from Blade Runner and The Fugitive, throwing in the then very trendy grunge theme and heaping a (bloody excellent) grunge/goth/industrial soundtrack on top to finish. For my eyes and ears its a very long rock video, with some decent action sequences, and a good indicator of future movies by Proyas. The lad takes a very poor script, makes a marketable object with it, it might be bit light on the intellectual palate,(so what?who says that's automatically a bad thing?). Its still good for my money, certainly worth watching, especially for Michael Wincott's incestuous very very bad guy, he just steals the show for turning up. Damned shame about Brandon Lee, he was starting to move up in the industry and given time, may have eclipsed his old dad.

Review title: Brilliant film...if your intelligent to really LOOK.
Review_body: This movie was terrific, the best of it's kind. Some people complain that it lacked character development of the part of Eric Draven, the character Brandon Lee portrayed. But in fact if you dive into the movie, you will see that they build his persona well. He has a sort of rage that anybody would if they knew they couldn't be stopped from avenging the death of the most important person in their life. It's a love story in the sickest dimensions, Fantastic. Lee was terrific in his role, as was villain, Michael Wincott as Top Dollar. The action was great, but more importantly the feel was incredible. This is a movie that I highly recommend to people. I am a big fan.

Review title: A Possibly Great Movie In It's Time That Did Not Age Well
Review_body: I really feel terrible writing this review, especially seeing everyone else raving about how great this movie is, and also, knowing about Brandon Lee's infamously tragic death on the set, but I must write on. Unfortunately, I watched this movie for the first time 10 years after it was released, I can only assume this was a costly mistake, the ruining of a legend for me. By the time it started, I knew I would be disappointed, and I was. To me, this movie was a tragic, god awful mess. Simply too melodramatic, too pseudo-poetic (psuedo as in what they tried to do did not work at all), and much too talky. Too many people explained way too many things that should have been inferred. Too many characters were stereotypes, mainly concepts represented by human bodies, and actors not doing a good job at portraying them. I know this may sound like blasphemy, but Brandon Lee, rest his soul, was not a good actor, at all. Actually quite the opposite. It looked like a terribly written movie with terrible actors, yet a big heart, that's the only good thing I could say about this movie.

I love this movie and can't say anything bad about it at all. I have always tried to spot the scenes in which digital effects were used to "add" Brandon into the scenes. The effects team did an outstanding job adding the various elements to the film and bring Brandon "back to life." When i learned of the tragedy I was devastated. i was even a bit scared that the film would never be released.This film is Brandon Lee's legacy. i am happy to see that it has so many fans and that the film was well received by audiences even after Brandon's shocking death. However, I am a bit fearful to hear that a "remake" is in the works? "gulp" I guess I just have to wait and see :)

In my opinion, The Crow is the greatest movie of all time. Brandon Lee's death had absolutely nothing to do with it, although it was a tragedy. That movie contained everything. Action, suspense, romance, horror, sci fi. It could literally fit into any category (accept for maybe porno). The diverse cast helped a lot showing that any one can be a bad guy. If you look at it, the character of Eric Draven is everybody. He's just your average Joe Shmoe who was scraping to make a living. There wasn't anything special about him until after he died. While Crow movies after this one may have had better special affects, or been less family friendly, there was a magic that these people brought to this movie that will never be recreated. Brandon Lee's death did not sell this movie, a story that everyone could relate to did.

Review title: Best movie I've seen in a while.
Review_body: You see a crow winging over a scene of urban decay; the majority of the buildings are on fire. A young girl's voice says, "People once believed that when someone dies, a crow carries their soul to the land of the dead. But sometimes, something so bad happens that a terrible sadness is carried with it and the soul can't rest. Then sometimes, just sometimes, the crow can bring that soul back to put the wrong things right." Welcome to the world of The Crow, one of the most powerful films ever made. The Crow, written by David J. Schow and John Shirley and directed by Alex Proyas. Its story is simple, much like the graphic novel by James O'Barr by the same name: a man and his fiancée are killed, she is raped and tortured, and he comes back as an undead to wreak bloody revenge on the gang that did these horrible things. The execution of the plot sets it apart from similar revenge tales. Everything from the scripting, the casting, the direction, and the acting set this from a simple popcorn movie and into the realm of true art.First, the scripting. There are so many wonderful quotes in this movie that it is impossible to list them all. Each character is given its own unique voice and personality, from the lowly hot-dog vendor to and especially the mysterious and creepy Top Dollar, head of Detroit's underworld of drugs and violence; who has a penchant for saying things like, "Dad gave me this. Fifth birthday. He said, 'Childhood's over the moment you know you're gonna die,'" while gazing at a snow-globe containing a miniature cemetery.Of course, brilliant as the script is, none of these characters would have found their unique voice if not for the casting by Billy Hopkins and Susan Smith. Michael Wincott is absolutely the only person to play the Top Dollar envisioned in this film. (In the comics, Top Dollar is just a leader of a small drug ring.) Ernie Hudson was a solid choice for Sgt. Albrecht. Introducing Rochelle Davis as the world weary and cynical at thirteen Sarah was a stroke of genius, and casting Brandon Lee as the title character, Eric Draven, a.k.a. The Crow, was an inspiration.Of course casting is only as good as the actors' performance. In other roles, Lee put in less than stellar performances, but as Draven, Lee created an opus. He takes a role that could easily been played as an emotionless machine and brought depth and humanity to it. In one ad-lib scene between Draven and Albrecht, he speaks lines that sum up the whole movie: "Little things use to mean so much to Shelley - I thought they were kind of trivial. Believe me, nothing is trivial." Then, as he starts to leave, Albrecht asks if he is just going to vanish again. Draven replies with a wistful smile, "I thought I'd just use the front door," making people see and feel the aching for normalcy in this character through his inflections and body language. Wincott is at his spooky best, but, surprisingly enough, also brings a dark sensuality to his character. Hudson underplays his role, lending it a certain believable, every-man quality, as him and Sarah are the two most normal and sanest people present in this dystopian view of Detroit. Particularly note worthy is the performance by David Patrick Kelley as T-Bird, the leader of the gang that murdered Eric and his fiancée, Shelly. He became so immersed in his role that he bought a classic first printing of Milton's Paradise Lost, Book IV, costing thousands that he was supposed to read from during the murder scene to use as a prop on the film. Rochelle Davis manages to walk a fine line of fragile, youthful hope, and the expected bitter cynicism that one might find in a thirteen year old whose mother is a drug addled prostitute. She brings pathos to this character without making it syrupy and unpalatable. It is true brilliance when one considers that this is her first role.The director of this film also did a superb job. Proyas brought the best out of his actors, obviously, but special attention should also be given to the rich visual styling of the film. The graphic novel was black and white, an ambiance that Proyas achieves in his film by shooting everything in washed out sepia tones making it feel like a rich and fantastically old picture book, or like the viewer is seeing things under water at dusk. Proyas did the unthinkable in that he worked lovingly on a low-budget action flick and elevated it to art. Of course this film, like any other, has its detractors. Some say that it glorifies violence. Granted. It does glorify violence revenge. That doesn't change the underlying fact that this is a truly beautiful film, and does have another, positive message of not taking one moment for granted with a loved one, since one never knows when that loved one won't be there any more. Some say that it is a simple "bug-hunt" film. Once again, this is true. The difference is that most such films are indifferently put together and aimed at the lowest common denominator, while this film strives for and achieves a higher level than that. Finally, some might say that it was ghoulish to release a movie where the star died while filming it. I must say that at first I thought the same thing. I was drug to this movie by a girlfriend, and I entered ready to hate it. Having seen it, and Brandon's other works, I have to say he would have wanted this movie released. It is his masterpiece. I can think of no better swan-song for any actor than the job that Brandon did on this film.
Ultimate cult classic. Rest in peace Brandon Lee . Such a great talent . such a waste.

Imagine a city where every person is a criminal and the cops just don't seem to notice. A studio cashes in on the name "Lee" with two hours of Hollywood cliches and stereotypes. His performance was so bad I bet this would have been Brandon Lee's last movie even if he hadn't died at the time. Even as the star of the movie he doesn't have that much screen time and has very few lines. Maybe unique for it's time, but it's now lost in the endless stream of mindless Hollywood comic book movies.

Review title: Eric Draven and his girlfriend are killed on Halloween night and the killers think they are home free.... until Eric comes back for revenge as the Crow.
Review_body: This is one of my all time favorite movies... it is amazing to say the least. The camera shots are beautiful, the scenery dark and Gothic, the dialog unforgettable, the acting phenomenal, great story and imagery. What more could you want?. The best part of it is that you have this indestructible guy that came back from the dead to avenge his death and the death of his fiancé, yet he is still gentle and caring to those that have helped him. I also love the interesting ways he takes out the murderers. Particularly when he killed Tin Tin. There are many great lines from this movie as well, like "He was already dead. He died one year ago the moment he touched her. They're all dead. They just don't know it yet."

Review title: my favorite and most watched movie
Review_body: The Crow pretty much grabs you and drags you in with a tone of seriousness and urgency. Brandon Lee was meant for the part as Eric Draven! The story along with the way the movie was shot (with an overall very dark and dreary feel) just gel together beautifully. An A list Soundtrack featuring Stone Temple Pilots, NIN, Pantera (R.I.P. Dimebag), Ministry, and many more. This movie would even be an excellent Broadway play! I would love to see it in that form, of course my wish cannot be fulfilled being that the perfect person for the role of Eric Draven (it just seemed natural for him)is not with us anymore. R.I.P. Brandon Lee.

I can say without a doubt that The Crow is the best movie ever made. From start to end, this film delivers something that you feel deep inside your soul. It's spiritual atmosphere pulls your mind completely into it. The story in itself leaves such an impression on you, you can't recall a better movie seen than this. The music matches the grieving pain and dark nature of this film perfectly. The score is by far the best I've ever heard. Return To The Grave and On Hollowed Ground is what caught my mind more than the others.Alex Proyas really has a view of everything and he deserves an Oscar for his work. Brandon Lee's performance deserves 10 Oscars but sadly he wouldn't be there to receive it. It's his death that may have attracted media attention but it's his performance that brings Eric Draven to life. His legacy lives on in the hearts of Crowfans forever.The supporting cast try their best and really give a great performance.The sets have a dark and goth feel to it, just as the movie is.You can watch it 200 times but still can't get enough of it. So, go buy the DVD, you won't regret it at all.

Review title: The Mother Of All Goth Movies!
Review_body: Having read the original comic book series in which this The Crow was based, one can see how a direct film translation would have been difficult to accomplish. Unfortunately several movie clichés have been added: A police man butting heads with his superior, a kidnapped girl, a grand finale on top of a cathedral (ala Batman, Metropolis), a buddy cop to the rescue, a villain that is killed by a hero who throws him off a very high place and onto a large pointy object. What THE CROW lacks in story is made up for with beautiful direction by Alex Proyas, stunning goth-noir cinematography, and a memorable theme by Graham Revell. This is more than your average comic book movie (do not expect a SPIDERMAN, BATMAN, or X-MEN). Here, our "hero"'s actions come from what he alone feels: pain, loss, anger, isolation, despair. His primary goal is not to bring justice to this world, his main goal is to kill those who have murdered him and his fiancé and to return to the grave where he can be reunited with her. Brandon Lee really is good in the lead roll, his presence can be felt throughout the film, including scenes filmed after his death. Had he lived he would have made an excellent action hero. Perhaps the MATRIX trilogy would have been better starring a real martial artist and a proved dramatic actor such as Brandon Lee.THE CROW has a real soul and inner life that is rare for action movies.

This movie, for those who have never seen it, which I am sure is a small number but what do I know, is an absolute Must See. It clings to every genre of film: comedy, Action, Thriller, Romance... it's the ultimate movie. I've favored this movie since the second time I saw it... I've watched it repeatedly so often that now it is a black and white film with a little red, red! The lines are beautiful, the characters well portrayed...I also like The Crow: City of Angels though the ending was a bit... eccentric, and The Crow: Salvation didn't much live up to my standards. The Crow: Wicked Prayer would have been better if Furlong wasn't trying so hard to deliver his lines like Brandon Lee in the first film. (not I do not say original because it has yet to be remade and I doubt it ever will) All in all, if you like a wide variety of films, definitely see this one, you should not be disappointed!
The crow is a complete masterpiece, probably the best movie ever. I´ve seen it over 50 times and I´m still touched of seeing it.

The Crow could quite possibly be one of the best movies ever made. It has this gut-ripping dark and moody atmosphere, that you seldom see anywhere else. Personally I always get a weird sensation in my stomach - not unlike butterflies - when I watch the Crow. -By the way, I would like to recommend the comicbooks... they are mostly very true to the Crow-concept. (-not like that godawful sequel... *sigh*)

Crow is the best movie I've ever seen. The atmosphere is incredible so is Brandon Lee who is still my favorite actor even though he is dead. I wish they wouldn't make the City of Angels.There is only one good movie based on the comic "The Crow" and that is the first movie with Alex Proyas as the director and Brandon Lee as the leading man. "The Crow" is a must-see.

Review title: A truly beautiful movie - both in the story and the acting of it.
Review_body: To confine the beauty of The Crow on paper (or on a page as it may be), seems a very limited form of expression. From the first time I saw this film, I was touched deeply by the story. The love between two people is so strong that a Crow can bring one man back to avenge their gruesome, murderous deaths.The story in itself is magical. The comics that it was based on were kept true in the film, due to the devotion shown by Brandon Lee and other cast and crew members. Such a story stays in your mind and influences your thoughts forever, it's a movie that I cannot ignore.The acting was superb. The honesty, acting ability, and the fact that Brandon Lee was an almost unrecognised star made the perfect combination, Lee fitted the role perfectly. For this reason, I believe that it really IS Brandon's film. Other roles, particularly that of Albrecht, were also played with nothing less than perfection.The follow ups to The Crow, however, are simply disgusting. To say the least, they are truly an insult to the work of everyone involved with The Crow. A study of the crew lists shows that many crew members on the original movie were not even consulted in the following attempts. I find the newer attempts are simply greedy money-making ideas, with no attention paid to the simple beauty of The Crow as a complete story in itself.Stop the sequels. The Crow is a classic - Brandon's film. Why can't they leave it that way?

This was his best movie, in the short career of a brilliant talented young man, just starting out in his movie career. I am the proud owner of "the Crow", "Rapid Fire" and "Showdown In Little Toyko" , all were excellent. He shall be missed.

Have you ever read the comic book that this movie was based upon. Well if you have or haven't it's pretty much a great adaption of the comic. Now the comic was black and white but the movie was color sort of, the only colors visible were warm colors i.e. fire. The flashback scene were also in color, vivid color I might add. The comics flashback were in watercolor. The comic book was a very dark and gritty comic that couldn't have been a movie if there wasn't an 'R' rating but there were a few choice things the movie chose to omit that were in the comic book. Go read the comic and you'll see this movie in a whole new light and after you do Look for James O Barr (the author, artist, creator of the Crow) in a cameo in the movie. Hint:He's the blond guy looting the pawn shop when Eric meets the cop.

The Crow mixes gothic themes with a gripping, emotional story.  It is a very dark, moody film, yet extremely moving.  All the performances were good, and Brandon Lee's was spectacular. Sadly, it was Brandon Lee's final film. However, he went out in a blaze of glory.

The Crow is, in my opinion, without a doubt, the best movie of it's genre. It is my favorite movie.  I think that the movie just has such an impact on you, it leaves sort of an emptiness in you.  I feel so strongly about this movie because, since I know that Brandon Lee died, I feel that the story is real or something.  Even with the errors in editing, I still give this movie a 10/10.  It has an explosive cast and unique storyline.  It seems that today, you can't say that about too many movies.  I think that this is a modern classic.  Many movies today seem to start off good, with a good cast or a twisted plot line, but in the end, they seem to spoil it by trying too hard.  But this movie is what it is.  Brandon Lee deserves much more recognition for this role than he got.  He had such a presence on screen. Other things about this movie that I liked are that there is drama, suspense, action, it's gothic, and yet it is still a love story.  And not to mention some really great lines!  The soundtrack and score are really good too.  I recommend this movie to everyone, except maybe like small kids or something.  SO GO RENT IT!!

This is just one of those films that you have to watch with the curtains drawn, the lights off, the doors locked, so that there can be no distractions. In my opinion, it's one of the best movies of the 90's. Although it shows its flaws after repeated viewings, the timeless story of justice for victims, coupled with a beautiful yet heartbreaking performance by the oh-so talented Brandon Lee, pushes it far above the rest.

Review title: A man comes back from the dead to exact revenge on his killers
Review_body: I know this movie isn't Academy material, but it was beautifully made. I felt everyone who starred in it played their characters perfectly. The dark, dreary, urban setting added to the film, and set the mood excellently for the story. Even though the plot isn't too eventful, it moves rather quickly. The events unfold and come together commendably, not leaving the viewer confused at the end. I thought this movie was a classic depiction of good vs evil, and will remain a favorite of mine forever. I give it 10 out of 10.

I think the screenplay was a marvelous translation of the comic- in fact, it propels the soul of the comic to it's full potential.  The screenwriter is worthy of great praises for his use of the characters, whom I believe find more depth in the movie then the original books themselves.The movie is excellent as a stand alone project, anyone unfamiliar with the books could watch and enjoy it.

Alex Proyas milks the plot for all its worth and  places The Crow beyond an average thriller and into the realm of motion picture brilliance. A heart warming tale backed up with enough gore and action to keep hard core violence fanatics interested. This stands The Crow as a masterpiece of cinematic wizardry, that is sure to impress even the most critical of viewers.

Review title: A stark yet moving story of love and Revenge
Review_body: This film is excellent. From the opening scene the style of photography, lighting and sound is set and it doesn't waver which is the mark of a good film. Brandon Lee's performance of a man returned from the dead and the pain and love and revenge which ensue are touching and make you believe in the characters. A truly great conversion of comic book to screen it is probably the best film of it's type. The violence is frequent yet feels that the violence is necessary due to the motivation of the characters and never did I feel that the film have just thrown the violence in for good measure. A must see for action fans and a truly great modern day tragedy and love story.

Review title: The big show of the 80's, in the 90's
Review_body: What we have here is a film made ten years after it might have been done. I'm sure that this film would have become a classic if it were made on the 80's, as it shows very well the spirit of the decade.It's a great show, a video-clip perfectly directed by Alex Proyas, whit drama and impacting action scenes, helped by a fantastic BSO, which fits the story perfectly (including a beautiful theme from The Cure).The characters are well written, much more than will be needed for a film like this. The script, mix of a fairy tale and a futuristic western,  is full of one-lines that give it lot of strength. The acting is as good as necessary, especially the bad boy played by Michael Wincott. The photography is great and the ambientation (the city looks a little like Burton's Gotham City) is as gothic as the rest of the film.Enjoying this film is so simple as viewing it. If you lived the 80's, you will understand why I think so.

Who says that excellent film noir movies had to have trench coat detectives and a very, very complicated plot? The Crow is certainly a brilliant film in its own kind, whether film noir or science fiction. Brandon Lee was spectacular in his final (and tragic) film. Lee could have been a major star after the film. Nevertheless, his Eric Draven has provided an 90's icon to a resurrected avenger.

one of my most favorite movies of all time... has romance, drama, violence, story, gothic atmosphere, good music, spiritualality, hope, and good wins in the end I would say this is how Brandon Lee would have wanted his last performance to be... Rest In Peace Brandon

We all now know what happened to Brandon. That is a fact and a sad one, however, I would just like to say, this is a beautiful film and I am so glad it was completed. The soundtrack, the ambiance, everything is excellent, I loved it! In a way a fairytale Gothic extravaganza, but so engaging, it will always be a classic in my collection. Brandon is mesmorising and alluring, (my wife can comply), if watched with an open mind it is a great representation of modern values of life (or lack of). I was a great believer in Bruce and was not disappointed in Brandon, I am sure he would have continued from strength to strength and delighted us all. I am just so sad that his time was cut so short! Rest in peace Brandon, you were a legend in you're own right!

I first saw THE CROW when I was twelve years old and I will forever be indebted to Both Brandon lee and Alex Proyas, up until that day i was your average primary coloured movie buff on diet of star wars and kung fu flicks, then things changed never before had i seen a film so striking so perfectly created. Brandon Lee's performance hit me right in the heart, I had never seen tragedy portrayed on screen with such aching melancholy (given real resonance by all too real tragedy) I wanted to be the Crow boyhood fantasies of star ships and lazer guns dissolved and were replaced with black leather and face paint, and the movie felt real despite its fantasy trappings you could believe a man could come back from the dead, you could believe the wrong things could eventually be made right, this is down to the director he created a world which totally complemented the story and most importantly Lee's performance. i have not seen a film since that has had the same effect on me nad in my opinion never will again. The only fault I can find is the tragic loss of its star that gives the film an extra layer of sadnness.My favorite film

This is simply the greatest comic book adaptation ever. It drips from beginning to end with stunning visuals and a script that that shows that someone put some thought into the story and how it would translate to the screen from the comic.Brandon Lee is brilliant and the film is fitting tribute to a great actor who suffered being sidelined as a kung fu actor. This shows how good he would have been had his life not been cruelly cut short while making this film.This film should be a benchmark for everyone trying to make an action film as its shows that an action film can have great acting, a brilliant script and be more than a collection of fight scenes.

Review title: A cult classic that influences cinema still
Review_body: A visual masterpiece. Brandon Lee shines as Eric Draven. A dark and gritty story with the tone to match. Excellent acting and directing. There's an obvious effect flaw in the car chase scene (done with miniatures), but the way it was shot adds a lot of realism. The knife catching scene is still the most convincing of it's type I've seen. The often overlooked Michael Wincott is a perfect maniac as Top Dollar. A comic book movie that predates the hype, it's influence can be seen in films like Blade, The Matrix, and even in professional wrestling.
Flawless film. From beginning to end. Wonderfully acted by every single actor and a perfectly told story.
After seeing the movie i cant get over the fact that brandon lee is dead,damn,its really a shame,he could be one of the best.

Director Alex Proyas has made a gothic masterpiece. Movie-Crow has the same strong dark and violent, but yet romantic atmosphere which makes the comic version so unique.Same way The Crow is unique movie. It is romantic, it is beautiful, but there is still some good stylish action scenes. And Brandon Lee is the one and only choice for playing the character of Eric Draven. This film needed agile and fast "action hero", not Van Damme or Steven Seagal style "slow but rigid" hunk.Maybe The Crow is not perfect movie if you watch all the story, acting, and photography, but the atmosphere is the magic thing, which makes the whole movie worth of ten points.

This movie is unique. I've not seen anything like it and it defies classification. Brandon Lee has good screen presence and the interview with him thats added to the home video product is as good as the movie. It shows an intelligent,sensitive young man who would have gone on to greater things.

This is my favorite movie. I bougth it this Monday and have seen 6 times on 5 days. Then to hell with the small errors in the movie, the feelings there. I have only seen Wicked prayer so i dant say if there is a better Crow movie but i doubt it. The way Brandon lee acts. And the dark feeling throughout the movie is the best i have ever seen. And the topped with a perfect soundtrack (The Cure my favorite bands on)it makes a perfect movie. And Michael Wincott is faboulus in the role of Top-Dollar, o hes evil. I myself is a goth, and this movie really reflects how movies should bee. Though the visuals are outdated it does have an emence kind of feeling to it which is just breath taking.

In loving memory of Brandon Bruce Lee. May his work live on for evermore.And the Raven, never flitting, still is sitting, still is sitting On the pallid bust of Pallas just above my chamber door; And his eyes have all the seeming of a demon's that is dreaming, And the lamplight o'er him streaming throws his shadow on the floor; And my soul from out that shadow that lies floating on the floor Shall be lifted- nevermore.The mythology of "The Crow" is something that people should really look at, if you're into that kind of stuff. The fact that "The Crow" comic was written to help the passing of the writers wife, she was killed by a drunk driver, and Brandon Lee was killed in the making of this movie. The story it's self is about death and murder. A flock of crows are called a murder. E.A. Poe's poem is about death as well. Maybe there's something behind all of this, or maybe not. It's all in the eye of the beholder.

Review title: In my opinion, the best film ever
Review_body: The Crow has got to be my favorite film ever. It has everything: intense plot, fascinating characters, dark atmosphere, fabulous soundtrack (both the songs and score, which I highly recommend) and great quotes.I love every character in the movie, even the gang members stand out individually in some way and don't come off as "just bad guys" as in the horrid sequel. Eric is a great character, somewhat crazy, tortured and sympathetic. Top Dollar makes a fantastic nemesis, he's an interesting character and has lots of great lines.Despite the dark atmosphere, the message is beautiful: true love an conquer even death. This film is definitely worth watching....over and over again.

Review title: Excellent story of a dead angel
Review_body: Movie itself is great, has a big suspence and that drop of pain that makes you feel alive. Plot is surprisingly marvellous, feelings are combined in the right way and director Proyas knew how to reach the top. A huge "bye" to wonderful Brandon Lee..

....this movie still gets to me.I remember seeing this movie in the theater at the tender age of 15. I never cry at movies, but the first (and only) time I ever did was at the end of this movie. For years, this movie haunted me; it permeated nearly every aspect of my existence. My bedroom walls were covered with posters from the film, I saved up the money to hunt down and purchase all of the comic books, and grew my hair long for the sole purpose of going out for Halloween as Eric Draven my senior year in high school. I wrote countless papers for various classes during my undergraduate study related to the film. Sometimes I feel like I know this movie better than the people who made it.It's funny how the things that are going on your life shape the way you experience the movies and music of your past. When life is good, it's easy to be over-analytical, to be hyper-critical, maybe even poke fun. I've been in this stage, watching this film and having almost no reaction to it whatsoever. However, there are times when life feels so dark and overwhelming and suddenly I'm that emotionally-vulnerable, confused 15-year-old kid again, carrying around the haunting images and music of the film in my head and trying to sort out the feelings evoked by it.And that's the beauty of this film. From the intensely angry expressions on Eric's face as he metes out his brand of justice to the tender moment he shares with Shelley before returning to the grave, this film encapsulates so many emotions; fear, rage, sadness, loneliness, hope, love, and redemption. The viewer can't help but have a bittersweet, visceral reaction to the film as we weep alongside Eric and revel in his revenge at the same time. An action-packed thriller it is, but this film really serves to remind us of how precious this life is; that every little moment we can share with those we love is to be treasured and cherished. And that when we love, we must love as long and as much as we can. Because, as Lee points out in his comments on the DVD extras, this "seemingly inexhaustible" well of life really is quite shallow, for we never really know when our time will come. This is the tragedy of both the film and of Brandon Lee's pointless death, but it can ultimately instill a sense of hope and purpose in those who heed the message.

This film is often classified as a horror movie, or an action movie.  But that's not what it's about.  The main theme of this movie is love, and how "when two people are meant to be together, nothing can keep them apart". Although violent, dark, and gritty, this film captures the strength of the love Eric and Shelly shared.  Eric is the anti-hero, played brilliantly by the late Brandon Lee.  His mission is simple--revenge.  But along the way, love gets involved, the love for Shelly, and for his friend Sarah.  This is a really excellent movie, with a strong theme.  The violence puts off some people, but I think if you give the movie a chance and see how the violence is justified, you'll be glad you saw it.

Review title: On the surface an ordinary action movie, however...
Review_body: A veil of darkness surrounds this movie. Not only because of the movie itself, but also due to the death of Brandon during the making. This gives the film an extra darkness and mystery around it.The story is about Eric Draven's search as an avenger to find justice for the brutal murder on him and his wife. He has been granted a dark and mysterious power of the crow and with this he seeks justice to them who were responsible for all of the pain and sadness.The film is a pretty straightforward action movie, yet it has a certain originality and quality. The dialogue thus the script is partly the reason, as well as the original comic.Micheal Wincott (Along came a Spider) and David Patrick Kelly (Twin Peaks) were among the cast, and Ernie Hudson (Oz) playing the sidekick as Cop Albrecht.One way or another, this movie was Brandon's big breakthrough and like his father he will be remembered for many generations to come.8/10

I don't know what it is about this movie, but to me it shows true love. Draven loved shelley so much that he still mourned even after death. I don't know why anybody would not like this movie. Well maybe for the language. As far as some of the sequels go, there will be no one to ever match Brandon Lee. His presence in the film is what made it great. There is more to this movie then what you see.

Review title: Great movie with a great soundtrack and storyline (WARNING- Very Mild Spoilers)
Review_body: There were a three things that atracted me to this movie and they were.1) The whole theme of the dead coming back to life intrests me and I am always keen to see a different take on the theme.2) The soundtrack: It contains mostly Gothic/Indie music, but the whole theme of the movie seems to be based around loosely around a post-Grunge america.3) The audience it attracts: The Crow is seen as a gothic film and is seen to have been made for goths. I am semi-gothic and am always interested to see films of this nature.With all those things in mind, the movie seemed irresistable and after i've seen it, it would now be in my top 10 movies of all time.The film is often violent, but somehow seems to keep a romantic and erotic feel to it, because after all, the whole movie is based on Eric's love for Shelly. It is also filled with minor jokes, which I found amusing.The only complaint I have about this movie is it didn't seem to have enough in it.I will look foward to seeing the sequel very much, and I recomend this film to anyone!

The Crow, one of my favorite movies. I saw this last week and I have to say I was very happy with the results of this film. The Crow is about a man and his girlfriend murdered on Devils night and a year later he comes back to get revenge. Brandon Lee gives a great performance, sadly his last. 10/10, Check it out. Rest in Peace Brandon Lee.

The first time I saw this movie I was around 10 or so and it was on TV and I absolutely loved it. It quickly became my favorite movie and actually had an effect on who I am today, it originally planted the idea of having long hair, it got me interested in the guitar and kinda planted the seed for me getting into rock and metal which if you ask anyone is one of the major things I'm known for along with my hair lol.through school I was always the kid that would write "Victims are we all" on my notebooks and stuff. A few years after I saw it for the first time, I was about 13, I found a copy of it on VHS at a rummage sale and I payed 2 dollars for it, now I'm 21 and I still own that same copy and I still watch it from time to time. It is one of the most amazing movies I have ever seen and it's one of those movies that I'll introduce my children to years down the road, I would even argue that it's better than Avatar lol. (:

Quote: "People once believed that when someone dies a crow carries that soul to the land of the dead. But sometimes something so bad happens that terrible sadness is carried with it. And the soul can't rest. And sometimes the crow can bring that soul back to put the wrong things right."
unbelievable movie. See It!

Review title: This is the best movie. Perfection has been redefined.
Review_body: This is my favorite movie. I believe it's also a classic because of the tragic death of the beloved actor, Brandon Lee, the son of Bruce Lee. This movie is worth the rent and you will probably end up buying it. And for those of you who were wondering he's not a ghost nor is he a superhero, his dead.

Great Movie. One of my favorites of all time. What can you really say. Such a great film. Brandon Lee was amazing but the whole cast was perfectly picked and they all nailed they're roles. Great script, directing. It's rare a movie is that perfect. The best vigilante type film I've ever seen. I was about 12 when I saw it and watched it over and over again and I can still watch it to this day. Amazing!

This is my all time lovin one, first saw it on the cinema when it got out, that was the first time i saw "slow motion moves" on a film, and after that i saw it again, and again, and again. Review title: Top 10 Worst Movies I Have Ever Watched!
Review_body: Wow, so before I watch any movie I always come to this site. If a movie get anything higher than a 7.3 I usually get excited. Seeing as how The Crow has a 7.5 I thought I would watch it. Little did I come to find that this movie wouldn't even get a 1/10 on my scale.What a horrible film. The acting was horrible and the story line was just bad. Brandon Lee was not a good actor and the supporting cast was extremely bad as well. The flow of the movie was awful as well leaving you hanging more than once.Maybe I'm being to hard on this film because it was made in 1993 and most movies back then were filmed the same way, but I literally fast forwarded to the end of the movie because I couldn't take it any longer.If they were to remake this film today, I believe it could be much better, but for the one I saw, it sucked!

This is by far my favorite movie! There are a lot of good movies that came before and after it but this one still stands out in my mind as the best. It has all the elements of life included in it, the most important Love. Brandon Lee is the best! It is a tragedy that he was taken from us so early in his life. I watch this movie every year at least for Halloween my favorite holiday. The other The Crow movies don't even compare to this one and it is sad that they tried to sequel perfection. Its like trying to make a sequel to Casablanca. I own this movie on DVD and Blu Ray and that is by far the way I best describe how good a movie is, by my willingness to own it.

Review title: I'm not sure why this movie is rated so high
Review_body: Simply put, this movie is very mediocre.The storyline is weak. A rock star and his fiancé are murdered on Halloween night by a gang of thugs. The rock star then returns from the dead to seek revenge on the murder and rape of his fiancé. Honestly, this plot screams cliché. The whole rock star idea is extremely cheesy and just reminds me of the rock band KISS and their dreadful costumes.The acting is decent. I feel that Brandon Lee gives off too much of a "good guy" vibe for his role. Despite being dressed up as a menacing, undead badass seeking revenge, he somehow still gives off the impression that he's a nice guy. The gang thugs seem a bit like they're trying too hard. They seem to act how they think thugs would act instead of acting like thugs. I just didn't buy it.The highlight of this film is the special effects, which were well done for 1994. Even so, they fail to outshine a cheesy plot and mediocre acting.Don't get me wrong, the movie wasn't all bad, but it just wasn't good. The Crow lies out there in the vast gray area of mediocre action films.

This is my all time favorite movie! The first time i saw it i was about 14years old. I've seen it so many times that i pretty much know every word. It combines all of the good genre's of movies. It had action, romance and thrill. None of the other "Crow" movies are as good or even compare to the first. One thing that amazes me about this movie is Brandon Lee actually died in the process of making it and they continued production. I never would have guessed that they could do that and it still turn out to be an amazing movie. My favorite line in the movie " Buildings burn, People die, but real love is forever." This line fits in with the movie because it is centered around Devils night and there is a group of "gang bangers" who go around setting fires, Brandon lee kills the bad guys who killed his fience.

Review title: A perfect example of Fantastic Film making
Review_body: May contain SpoilersThey are many things to be liked about THE CROW namely; Drama - " Little things used to mean so much to Shelley, I used to think they were kinda trivial. Believe me, nothing is trivial. " The side stories involving Sarah, Albrecht and Darla's Drug Problem and well paced and acted Action - " I see you have made your decision, now lets see you enforce it " Before the days of super slow-mo, The Crow gave Eric Draven the human fighting style he fights in a very realistic fashion. Comedy - " You picked a bad day to be a bad guy huh, Skank " "I'm not Skank, that's Skank right There!. Skank Dead" " Thats Right" There is an underlying humour in this film. ________________________A highly recommended film. Beats most of the movies around today.

Review title: the best movie in the world- EVER
Review_body: absolutely perfect- there's poetry, justice, tragedy, retribution, romance and...a bit of kung fu. the best movie in the world- EVER. i love the comic, and I'm a big comic fan, but this is the one time i can say the movie is so much better than the already-legendary comic, there's barely any comparison. i have to make this 10 lines so; this movie is the only one where i felt i REALLY wanted the hero to have justice, the bad guys HAD to get their penance, i even wanted the police man guy to be OK in the end! (but i wont say if he is or not) i know there are a lot of movies out there can make you cry and laugh, but this one is the only one that blends a full range of emotions and balances it out with well timed scenes and perfectly placed lines. it is too good to analyse, but i'll say this; some eccentric camera angles, quirky lighting and film noir-esquire shots make this as unusual as it is practically revolutionary. there's even the essential cheesy line in there somewhere :)

Review title: I don't know why this movie rated so high. Wast of time
Review_body: I wasted 97 minutes of my life on this crap because of this IMDb rating. But I will advise who hasn't still seen this movie don't waste your time on this crap movie. I really wanted to see and like that movie but honestly speaking while watching the movie i dozed off a few times. Acting, screenplay, direction and every other thing about the movie are so poor and mediocre I cant help but to dislike the movie.
